instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A2289: What is A2289? A2289 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2020 with EMC 3456, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01987..
definitions.820-01987: What is 820-01987? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.R7021: What is R7021? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7022: What is R7022? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2289</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A 5v .31ma
threads.message:
No sign of spillage on the board that I can see.
It draws 5v .31ma .
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 1v diode reading .385. I have tried dfu mode but host Mac can not see it. I tried removing <CHIP>U4770</CHIP> and reprogramming it but still same.
I cannot find any shorts on the board.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2289</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A 5v .31ma
threads.message:
You can't do anything until get <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> at least.

Do you get 5V at <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>?
If yes, post its basic voltages; <SIGNAL>P_IN</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>AUX_DET</SIGNAL>, VDDA/P.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2289</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A 5v .31ma
threads.message: <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> <RESISTOR>R7021</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R7022</RESISTOR> were both high 87k and small  discoloration on <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> so changed both resistors and now getting 20v 0.27v, <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is now 11.2v . I can now get it into dfu mode but it keeps erroring out on host machine. The host is running Big Sur, not sure what the faulty one was running.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2289</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A 5v .31ma
threads.message: How does it ready when you put it in DFU mode and choose recover? Do you hav a stable internet connection?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2289</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A 5v .31ma
threads.message: Yes internet is stable. I have tried recover and also revive but errors out on both. Also it shows the recovery screen as in pic when mac is plugged in without pressing any buttons but if you hold power for a few mins the hold all 4 buttons it says DFu not recovery but still the same outcome. Also the target mac screen shows logo with progress bar fully across then disappears then the error in pic shows on host machine.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2289</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A 5v .31ma
threads.message: Try DFU mode disconnecting battery and charger.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2289</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A 5v .31ma
threads.message: Do you mean with battery disconnected? if so then yes I have tried that a few times, same error.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2289</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A 5v .31ma
threads.message:
And charger disconnected also.
5V from AC2 machine is good enough...

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2289</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A 5v .31ma
threads.message: Is there a special way to do that as I cannot get the host to see the mac with charger and battery disconnected?.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2289</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A 5v .31ma
threads.message: Use SE032 to force DFU mode.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2289</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A 5v .31ma
threads.message: What is the procedure to do this ? Do I inject voltage?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2289</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A 5v .31ma
threads.message:
Temporar contact on SE032 pads, to force DFU; without charger, nor battery connected.
The 5V from the other machine (with AC2), will power the board.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2289</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A 5v .31ma
threads.message:
Hi thanks for the info but still the same. It just says "The system cannot be restored on this device" and also "Gave up waiting for the device to transition from DFU state to Dfu state".  I have tried several different macs, Os and cables.

I have a t2 rom programmer is there any use in flashing <CHIP>U4700</CHIP>? if so any idea where I can find clean dump for this chip.

Thanks

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2289</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A 5v .31ma
threads.message:
Do you mean <CHIP>U4770</CHIP>?
Some people claim on Internet to revived dead boards reflashing it; no mention about this particular board.

I remember when I flashed SoC ROM between two 01521 and I lost even 20V on USB-C input.
Do not trust all you read on Internet...

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2289</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A 5v .31ma
threads.message: Yes that is correct <CHIP>U4770</CHIP>. I was going to look for clean dump for this board to try but can only find the ones that come with the t203 programmer but Im not sure if these are clean or modified dumps.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2289</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A 5v .31ma
threads.message:
What clean means?
That is not BIOS with ME region...

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2289</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A 5v .31ma
threads.message: I mean the dumps you get with the t203 are modified are they not?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2289</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A 5v .31ma
threads.message:
No idea.
As I said, read dump from 01521 didn't work for me in other 01521 board.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2289</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A 5v .31ma
threads.message: Is there anything else I could look at regarding signals voltages ect ?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2289</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A 5v .31ma
threads.message: If cannot complete DFU not much to do...
